resources.string: "There was an error retrieving your daily keys"
"The test version of the application requires permission to record device tracking logs."
"No, I'm healthy and I don't suffer from chronic diseases"
"Tick the ailments you are suffering from:"
"Do you smoke cigarettes or other tobacco products?"
"Thank you for completing the Risk Assessment Test"
"Based on your answers, our system will now assign you to the relevant group."
"It is very important that you complete the tests on a daily basis. We will remind you about it :)"
"Call your parents and elderly relatives. Help them to use STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe on their phone. Do the shopping for them. Avoid personal contact."
": record your symptoms and body temperature in the app."
"If you or your loved ones develop symptoms of coronavirus infection, call the free, 24-hour helpline"
" notifications about possible contact with the coronavirus."
"Take care of yourself! Check regularly whether you belong to the risk group"
"I feel unwell, what should I do?"
"With whom I have met, where I have been"
"I don't want to provide this information"
"Why is it worth to provide this information?"
"Age is an important factor in the calculation of infection risk assessment. The elderly and people with reduced immunity are particularly vulnerable to the effects of the coronavirus."
"Tick the countries you have visited in the last 14 days."
"It is very important that you complete the tests regularly. We will remind you about it :)"
"Click below and perform the risk assessment test."
"Remember! The results of the interview are for informational purposes only. They cannot be interpreted or treated as a medical advice, consultation or diagnosis."
"Notification of possible contact with the coronavirus is disabled"
"Up-to-date information on the epidemic situation, as well as other advice and tips can be found at www.gov.pl/koronawirus"
"Test results are for informational and educational purposes only. Don't treat them as a medical consultation or diagnosis."

"is an application that will help us overcome the most severe restrictions related to the pandemic. The more of us will use it, the faster and more effectively we will reduce the pace and extent of the spread of the coronavirus. It is also professional help for both healthy and infected people."
"Our application uses an API developed by Google and Apple."
"There is not enough information to analyse your risk of coronavirus infection."
"Complete the risk assessment test or wait for information about contacts with infected persons."
"Call your GP as soon as possible and tell him/her about your symptoms. Your GP will conduct a medical interview and invite you to a medical appointment if necessary."
"The list of primary health care facilities that provide teleconsultation, as well as other facilities, including open specialist clinics, gynaecological and dental offices, is available on"
"the website of the National Health Fund (NFZ)"
"suggestion to go for a personal visit to the facility or contact a sanitary and epidemiological station."
"reduce the risk of spreading the coronavirus,"
"allow you to dispel your doubts without leaving home,"
"shorten the waiting time for a doctor's appointment."
"Teleconsultation don't obstruct direct access to the doctor. The doctor will refer you to a medical facility or recommend contacting a sanitary and epidemiological station, if necessary."
"Wash your hands regularly with soap and water, or disinfect them with an alcohol-based agent (minimum60%). Washing your hands should take 30 seconds. Please familiarise with"
"Cover your mouth and nose when you cough or sneeze"
"Cough or sneeze in disposable handkerchief, alternatively in the elbow bend. Throw the handkerchief in the trash as soon as possible and wash your hands thoroughly."
"Avoid close (less than 2 meters) contact with other people."
"Avoid touching your face, especially your eyes, nose, and mouth"

"The virus enters the body through the mouth, nose and eyes. You can move it from a contaminated surface. Viruses can persist for hours or days on objects contaminated with secretions such as saliva. According to current knowledge, the coronavirus can survive for up to 3 hours in aerosol particles, up to 24 hours on cardboard and up to 72 hours on stainless steel or plastic."
"Limit exits from home to the strictly necessary. This way you protect yourself and others."
"In a life-threatening or health-threatening condition, do not wait, call the emergency number"
"Set up a teleconsultation with primary care physician."
"Information about the health care facilities is updated on a regular basis."
"on the website of the Chief Sanitary Inspectorate."
"Monitor your health condition. If it is alarming or worsening - react."
"Find the number of the nearest station"
"Check out where to find a hospital with an infectious diseases department"
"Before appearing in the department, consult the hospital by phone or, if possible, contact your primary care physician by phone."
"The list of primary health care facilities providing teleconsultation in your area is available"
"on the website of the National Health Fund (NFZ)"
"Be sure to wear a mask when leaving home, and always cover your mouth and nose when coughing or sneezing."
"Don't use public transport to get to the hospital. If you don't have your own transport, the sanitary inspector can send a vehicle to pick you up."
"Check out where to find a hospital with an infectious diseases department"
"In a life-threatening or health-threatening condition (e.g. shortness of breath), call an ambulance by calling the emergency number"
". Be sure to mention that it may be about a patient with coronavirus."

"If you have a mask, wear it every time someone from outside enters the room or vehicle in which you are present. Also put it on when you enter medical facilities. People who are near you should also wear a mask, especially if you cannot put it on yourself (e.g. when it increases breathing difficulties)."
"See how to safely put on and take off your mask"
"A few simple rules with which you can significantly reduce the risk of infecting yourself or spreading infection to others:"
"Wash your hands regularly with soap and water, or disinfect them with an alcohol-based agent (minimum60%). Washing your hands should take 30 seconds. Please familiarise with"
"Avoid touching your face, especially your eyes, nose, and mouth."
"Cough or sneeze in a disposable handkerchief, alternatively in the elbow bend, and disinfect your hands after you sneeze."
"Choose a set of mugs, cutlery and other kitchen utensils that only you will use."
"Immediately notify the district sanitary and epidemiological station by phone or go to an infectious diseases department"
"Report directly to the infectious diseases department or the observation and infectious diseases department"
"provided on the website of the Chief Sanitary Inspectorate."
"You're feeling very bad? Don’t wait. Call the emergency number 112 or 999. Inform about your disease."
"Remember to disinfect or wash your hands with soap and water regularly and keep the social distance."
"Monitor your health regularly, take your temperature twice a day and record it in your Health Diary."
"If you develop symptoms such as: fever, cough or shortness of breath, call your doctor or use the free teleconsultation provided by a healthcare professional."
"Your condition is severe? Don’t wait. Call the emergency number"
" and notify that you may have coronavirus."
"for how long? Please specify in years with an accuracy of 0.25 year"
"the use of drugs that reduce immunity (immunosuppressants)"
"please specify in years with an accuracy of 0.25 year"
"please specify in years with an accuracy of <=1, 3, 5, 10, 15 or more than 15 years"
"Find the number of the nearest station"
"Check out where to find a hospital with an infectious diseases department"
"Before appearing in the department, consult the hospital by phone or, if possible, contact your primary care physician by phone."
"A list of primary health care facilities providing teleconsultation in your area is available"
"on the website of the National Health Fund (NFZ)"
"Be sure to wear a mask when leaving home, and always cover your mouth and nose when coughing or sneezing."
"Don't use public transport to get to the hospital. If you don't have your own transport, the sanitary inspector can send a vehicle to pick you up."
"Check out where to find a hospital with an infectious diseases department"
"In a life-threatening or health-threatening condition (e.g. shortness of breath), call an ambulance by calling the emergency number"
". Be sure to mention that it may be about a patient with coronavirus."

"If you have a mask, wear it every time someone from outside enters the room or vehicle in which you are present. Put it on also when you enter medical facilities. People who are near you should also wear a mask, especially if you cannot put it on yourself (e.g. when it increases breathing difficulties)."
"See how to safely put on and take off your mask"
"A few simple rules with which you can significantly reduce the risk of infecting yourself or spreading infection to others:"
"Wash your hands regularly with soap and water, or disinfect them with an alcohol-based agent (minimum60%). Washing your hands should take 30 seconds. Please familiarise with"
"Avoid touching your face, especially your eyes, nose, and mouth"
"Cough or sneeze in a disposable handkerchief, alternatively in the elbow bend, and disinfect your hands after you sneeze."
"Choose a set of mugs, cutlery and other kitchen utensils that only you will use."
"Immediately notify the district sanitary and epidemiological station by phone or go to an infectious diseases department"
"Report directly to the infectious diseases department or the observation and infectious diseases department"
"provided on the website of the Chief Sanitary Inspectorate."
"Wash your hands regularly with soap and water, or disinfect them with an alcohol-based agent (minimum60%). Washing your hands should take 30 seconds. Please familiarise with"
"Cough or sneeze in a disposable handkerchief, alternatively in the elbow bend. Throw the handkerchief in the trash as soon as possible and wash your hands thoroughly."
"Avoid close (less than 2 meters) contact with other people."

"The virus enters the body through the mouth, nose and eyes. You can move it from a contaminated surface. Viruses can persist for hours or days on objects contaminated with secretions such as saliva. According to current knowledge, the coronavirus can survive for up to 3 hours in aerosol particles, up to 24 hours on cardboard and up to 72 hours on stainless steel or plastic."
"Limit exits from home to the strictly necessary. By doing this, you will reduce the risk of the coronavirus spreading, as well as protect yourself and others."
"Go through this interview again when new symptoms develop or you come into contact with a person tested positive."
"on the website of the Chief Sanitary Inspectorate."
"Cover your mouth and nose when you cough or sneeze"
"Avoid touching your face, especially your eyes, nose, and mouth"

"You must quarantine at home; at the address you indicate in advance. You cannot change the quarantine location. If you don't have the option to quarantine at home, you can do it in a facility indicated by the relevant authorities."
"Under no circumstances leave your home. You're not allowed to go out to do shopping, walk the dog, or see a doctor."
"If you have pets with you, give them to your relatives or friends for the duration of the quarantine if possible. If you are unable to do so, contact the commune for help by phone."
"Don't meet with other people or invite people to your place."
"If you live with your family, they are also quarantined."
"Monitor your body temperature at least twice a day."
"Provide information about your health condition to the employees of the poviat sanitary and epidemiological station who call you."
"Cooperate with policemen who will check whether you comply with the quarantine."
"Wash your hands regularly with soap and water, or disinfect them with an alcohol-based agent (minimum60%). Washing your hands should take 30 seconds. Please familiarise with"
"Cover your mouth and nose when you cough or sneeze"
"Cough or sneeze in a disposable handkerchief, alternatively in the elbow bend. Throw the handkerchief in the trash as soon as possible and wash your hands thoroughly."
"Avoid close (less than 2 meters) contact with other people."
"Avoid touching your face, especially your eyes, nose, and mouth"

"The virus enters the body through the mouth, nose and eyes. You can move it from a contaminated surface. Viruses can persist for hours or days on objects contaminated with secretions such as saliva. According to current knowledge, the coronavirus can survive for up to 3 hours in aerosol particles, up to 24 hours on cardboard and up to 72 hours on stainless steel or plastic."
"Use separate utensils and a separate bathroom"
"If you cannot use a separate bathroom or toilet, disinfect it with an available cleaning agent."
"Air your apartment several times a day"
"Often disinfect surfaces such as countertops, door handles or phone screens. Clean the devices you use after using them."
"In the event of a sudden deterioration of your health conditions and symptoms such as:"
"immediately notify the poviat sanitary and epidemiological station by phone and report directly to the infectious diseases department or the observation and infectious department."
"Find the number of the nearest station"
"Check out where to find a hospital with an infectious diseases department"

"When moving to an infectious diseases hospital, be sure to wear a face mask and always cover your mouth and nose when you cough or sneeze. Don't use public transport to get to the hospital. If you don't have your own transport, the sanitary and epidemiological station can send an ambulance to pick you up."
"In a life-threatening or health-threatening condition (e.g. shortness of breath), call an ambulance by calling the emergency number"
". Be sure to mention that it may be about a patient with coronavirus."
"You are not left alone during quarantine. Many places provide the necessary information and offer additional help, such as material assistance and help with shopping:"
"Call the social welfare centre in your place of residence. A social worker from the social welfare centre will contact you by phone."

"Police officers who check that you are at home will pay particular attention to people who are alone, elderly or disabled. They will provide information about such persons to the social welfare centre."

"If you are unable to provide yourself with a hot meal or food products and you cannot count on help from your family, the commune will help you. Meals and food products will be provided by designated persons in cooperation with volunteers of non-governmental organisations."
"If you need a psychologist's help, call the social welfare centre in your commune or the poviat family support centre in your poviat."
"on the website of the Chief Sanitary Inspectorate. "
"Monitor your health condition. If it is alarming or worsening - react."
"Don't be afraid to ask for help"

"Although your symptoms are most likely caused by another illness, stay home until you recover. Resting at home will not only allow you to recover faster, but also reduce the risk of infection to yourself and others, especially the elderly and the less immune."
"Wash your hands regularly with soap and water, or disinfect them with an alcohol-based agent (minimum60%). Washing your hands should take 30 seconds. Please familiarise with"
"Cough or sneeze in a disposable handkerchief, alternatively in the elbow bend. Throw the handkerchief in the trash as soon as possible and wash your hands thoroughly."
"Avoid close (less than 2 meters) contact with other people."

"The virus enters the body through the mouth, nose and eyes. You can move it from a contaminated surface. Viruses can persist for hours or days on objects contaminated with secretions such as saliva. According to current knowledge, the coronavirus can survive for up to 3 hours in aerosol particles, up to 24 hours on cardboard and up to 72 hours on stainless steel or plastic."
"Limit exits from home to the strictly necessary. It is a way to protect yourself and others, reducing the risk of spreading the coronavirus."
"Monitor your health condition several times a day. Take your body temperature every few hours."
"Go through this interview again when new symptoms develop or you come into contact with a person tested positive."
"Take a break and stay at home"
"on the website of the Chief Sanitary Inspectorate."
"Cover your mouth and nose when you cough or sneeze"
"Avoid touching your face, especially your eyes, nose, and mouth"
"If you want to learn more about the factors that influence your risk of infection, click below and take the risk assessment test."
"If you have additional questions or concerns, please go to"
", where you can chat with a consultant. You can also call the National Health Fund (NFZ) helpline"

"is a free, official and safe application that allows you to be notified about the risk of coronavirus infection. In the application, you can also assess the risk of coronavirus infection, keep a health diary and learn how to avoid infection."
"By observing the results and applying remedial measures, you minimise the risk of getting sick."
"Thanks to the application, you keep your finger on the pulse - you take care of your health and the health of your loved ones."
"Notification of the risk of coronavirus infection"

" - using the joint efforts of Apple and Google and in cooperation with public health institutions, we have implemented a solution that, based on a risk level analysis and based on the data of devices encountered, enables notification of contact with an infected person."

" - we have developed it based on the guidelines of the World Health Organization (WHO). Thanks to the test, you will learn, among others, how to take care of your health and how to act in case of suspected infection."
" - makes it easier to keep daily health records, including recording symptoms."
" - guidelines on where to seek expert help, up-to-date information and recommendations, if needed."
" - the information you updated on a regular basis will help doctors make a diagnosis, if necessary. Only they can do it."
"Important note! The risk assessment test is NOT a diagnosis."

"* Communication with the user – sending verified messages from WHO and the Ministry of Health. How quickly we defeat the coronavirus and return to normal life depends on our attitude. Use our application, follow the guidelines! Keeping a health diary is very simple and doesn't take long. Start today – take care of yourself and your loved ones."
"Self-observation - stay at home and monitor your health condition"
"and monitor your health condition. Call the free, 24-hour helpline"
" or your local health care facility. Important note! Don't go there."
": record your symptoms and body temperature in the app."
", cover your mouth and nose when coughing and sneezing. Wash hands regularly and thoroughly."
"If you encounter new symptoms of infection or worsening of existing ones, please contact the free, 24-hour helpline again"
"your local health care facility (don't go there!)."
"Your consent to receiving notifications is required in order for the application to function properly. Click below and help STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe protect the health of us all."
"It’s in your hands. This version of the application uses iOS / Android tools to notify about possible contact with the coronavirus."

"Allow the app to anonymously record encountering other devices. Thanks to this, when a user of one of them becomes sick, you will receive appropriate notification. Take care of your health and the health of your loved ones."
"One of the main features of this application is the coronavirus infection risk assessment test. We have prepared it in accordance with the guidelines of the World Health Organization (WHO)."
"This can only be done by a doctor and with the use of a medical test for the virus."
"- you do it for your own "

"Something is wrong. Check your device - update your phone's operating system. This is necessary if you want to take full advantage of all the functionalities of the application. Updated Android devices support notifications of possible contact with the coronavirus."

"Only iPhones with iOS 13.5 and newer support notifications of possible contact with the coronavirus. Check your device - update your phone's operating system. This is necessary if you want to take full advantage of all the functionalities of the application."
"Update the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe application to take full advantage of all the functionalities."
"Calling to the helpline is free of charge, the helpline is available 24 hours a day."

"The application consists of two modules. The first module is designed for self-monitoring of health condition. It's a kind of \"diary\" that allows you to verify on an ongoing basis whether and in what risk group you are. This solution is based on the guidelines of the World Health Organization (WHO)."
"The second module is scanning your surroundings and will notify you in case of risk of contact with the virus."

"If you turn on Bluetooth on your phone, the application will communicate with other users' devices. Don't worry, it will not share with them any data about you. No one will be able to access the contents of your phone."
"Information about the devices encountered doesn't contain any data about their owners, it is anonymous, encrypted, and is stored on the phone for two weeks only. Then it is deleted."

"Why is the history of such meetings useful? When one of the users, whose phone has been met by your phone, gets sick – you will receive appropriate information. You won't be notified who got sick. Instead, you will learn how to behave and what to do to take care of your health."
"The privacy of the app users is our top priority. We have built STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe in accordance with, among others, the European Commission guidelines."

"The STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe application doesn't track users. Work on the app is fully open and transparent from the very beginning. We are aware that in order to fulfil its role, it must gain the trust of users."
"The application is completely safe, free of charge and voluntary."

"Research shows that effective isolation of the infected persons and the use of exposure notification applications (such as STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe) can reduce the risk of spreading the coronavirus by 44%. However, there is one condition - the application must be used by as many people as possible."
"Feel free to contact us if you have any questions:"

"Together we want to prevent Coronavirus. But your privacy is equally important to us. We designed the application so that all the information you provide to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe prevents your identification. Therefore, you don't need to register an account, we don't ask you for an e-mail address, or linking the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe with a social media account."

"If we shall plan any changes, we will inform you about it. You will be able to use most of the new features on an opt-in basis. This means that you can voluntarily use the new functionality or not use it. Details on the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe application can be found in the Terms & Conditions, and information on the processing of your data can be found in the Privacy Policy."

"We have prepared this document to inform you how we process data in STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe, as well as what rights you are entitled to. Below you will find key information related to data processing occurring as part of our Application."

"We have designed STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe in accordance with the Privacy by Default and Privacy by Design principles. This means that we apply the protection of your privacy by default and we have tried to limit the processing of information about you already at the stage of designing and creating the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe application. We try not to obtain from you the information that would enable your identification (i.e. personal data), as we believe that effective pandemic prevention"
"does not require the processing of personal data that identify the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Users."
"The information processed by STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe does not allow your identification."

"We will not have access to personal data that you enter into the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe application. We will not take active steps to identify you. We will also not analyse how you use STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe."

"Information entered into STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe related to the Triage (self-assessment of the risk of infection with COVID-19 - Triage Module) is analysed within STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe without leaving your device."

"The functionality of analysing exposure to COVID-19 infection as a result of contact with other Application Users (Analytical Module) is voluntary. You have the option of analysing the potential exposure"

"will give positive result, a Contact Centre consultant will call you to inform you about the positive result of the test. Then the Contact Centre consultant will ask you if you have the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe application installed. If this is the case, the Contact Centre consultant will offer you to notify other Users that they have stayed near the Device of a Person Tested Positive"
"within the last 14 days, by providing you a PIN Code. The PIN Code confirms that your Device is a Device of a Person Tested Positive"

"This confirmation is anonymous, and neither we nor other Users will be able to distinguish individual Devices and assign specific Users to them. After entering the PIN Code, the process of sending the anonymous Diagnostic Key to the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe server, and then to the Devices of other Users, will be initiated in order to analyse the risk of COVID-19 infection. Entering the PIN Code to the Device is voluntary."

"The Diagnostic Key sent from your Device to the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Server will not contain any data enabling identification or information about the Devices you have had contact with. It is up to you to decide whether you want to mark your Device as a Device of a Person Tested Positive, which will initiate the sending of an anonymous Diagnostic Key to the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Server, and then to other Application Users. Each Application, after receiving the Diagnostic Key, performs an automatic analysis of meetings by appropriate comparison of the received Diagnostic Key with the history of meetings of Devices with the installed Application from the last 14 days. The analysis is performed independently on the Device of each User, it takes into account in particular the Users' distance (signal strength) and the time of staying in the vicinity of an infected person and as a result the status of the current risk group may be changed."

"This Privacy Policy sets out the rules for the collection, processing and protection of Users' Personal Data in connection with the use of the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe application. Neither the Chief Sanitary Inspector (GIS) nor the Ministry of Digital Affairs (MC) identifies STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Users."

"By downloading STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe from the Play Store or the AppStore and installing it, the User gives the consent referred to in Article 173 paragraph 1 point2 of the Telecommunications Law; the Terms & Conditions and the Privacy Policy constitute the information referred to in Article 173 paragraph 1 point1 of the Telecommunications Law."

"This document is prepared on the basis of the provisions of Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of individuals with regard to the processing of Personal Data and on the free movement of such data and the repeal of Directive 95/46/EC (General Regulation on Data Protection), the Act of 10 May 2018 on the protection of Personal Data (Journal of Laws of 2018, item 1000) and other generally applicable provisions."
"If you have general questions regarding privacy, as well as questions regarding this Privacy Policy, please contact us at:"

"GIS ensures that it makes every effort to make the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Application ensure the highest standard of Users' privacy protection, and in particular ensures that it has taken all legal and technologically possible measures aimed at securing Users' privacy."

"GIS declares that it uses technical and organisational measures to ensure the protection of Users' privacy, which are appropriate to the threats and categories of information protected, in particular, it uses encryption and protects information against disclosure to unauthorised persons, removal by an unauthorised person, processing in violation of the law as well as alteration, loss, damage or destruction."

"- it is understood as the Minister of Digital Affairs based in Warsaw, at ul. Królewska 27, 00-060 Warsaw. Based on an agreement concluded with GIS, MC supports GIS in the development and maintenance of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe."

"- it is understood as the Chief Sanitary Inspector based in Warsaw, at ul. Targowa 65, 03–729 Warsaw. GIS is the controller of personal data within the meaning of the GDPR in relation to the personal data of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Users. GIS independently determines the purposes and methods of processing Personal Data within STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe."

"- it is understood as any information relating to an identified or identifiable natural person within the meaning of Article 4 point 1 of the GDPR. The Processing of Personal Data in STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe shall be governed by Article 11 of the GDPR, as the purpose of processing does not require identification, therefore STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Users are not identified."

"- it is understood as the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe application, which includes the Analytical Module, the Triage Module and the Health Diary Module, and also supports the prophylaxis and prevention of infection, transmits important information related to the pandemic"
"- it is understood as the document that specifies the terms of use of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe, as well as the rights and obligations of GIS, MC and Users."

"- it is understood as the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe functionality that enables saving, creating history and analysing the meeting of the User's Device with other Application Users' Devices. The Analytical Module is based on the Privacy-Preserving Contact Tracing API developed and made available by Google and Apple. The information generated by the Analytical Module along with the results of its work is stored locally on the Device for 14 days. Google and Apple in their documentation, which can be found here:"
"- it is understood as the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe functionality that allows the User to perform a self-assessment of the risk of exposure to infection"
", based on the WHO questionnaire. Personal Data entered into the Triage Module are stored locally on the User's Device."

"- it is understood as a randomly generated, periodic and alphanumeric string of characters sent to the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Server, which contains anonymised Personal Data, initiating the process of analysis of exposure to infection"
"as part of the Analytical Module. The Diagnostic Key is transferred to the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Server after the Person Tested Positive enters the PIN Code into the Application."

"- it is understood as the cloud infrastructure maintained by the National Cloud Operator, used to transmit the Diagnostic Key to Users' Devices. Diagnostic Keys are stored on the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Server in an encrypted form for 14 (fourteen) days."
"- it is understood as the unit providing the test result by phone "
", transmitting the PIN Code to the Application Users and providing information related to"

"- it is understood as the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe notepad-like functionality, enabling the User to record information about their health. Personal Data entered into the Health Diary Module are stored locally on the User's Device."

"- it is understood as the Regulation (EU) 2016/679 of the European Parliament and of the Council of 27 April 2016 on the protection of natural persons with regard to the processing of personal data and on the free movement of such data, and repealing Directive 95/46/EC (General Data Protection Regulation)."

"- it is understood as an electronic device through which the User gains access to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe (tablet, smartphone, etc.) with an active Bluetooth module, Android 5.0 or higher with access to the Google Play store or with an iOS system in a version not lower than 13.5 with access to the AppStore. The Analytical Module will work only on Devices with Android 6.0 supporting BLE technology or higher, or with an iOS version 13.5 or newer."
"- it is understood as a person with full legal capacity who, after accepting the Terms & Conditions and the Privacy Policy, uses STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe."
"- it is understood as the World Health Organization."

"The Processing of Personal Data in STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe shall be governed by Article 11 of the GDPR, as the purpose of processing does not require User identification. When designing the STOP COVID-ProteGO Safe technical security measures, GIS and MC exercised due diligence to prevent identification of Users. However, due to the fact that the User's Personal Data is processed locally as part of the Application, despite the lack of access to it by GIS as the data controller, the Regulation still applies."
"Personal Data is processed on the basis of"
"Article 6, paragraph 1, letter e, of the GDPR"

"in connection with a task carried out in the public interest consisting in preventing, counteracting and combating COVID-19 resulting from Article 1, 2, 3, 6 and 8a paragraph 1, 4 and 5 of the Act of 14 March 1985 on the State Sanitary Inspection (Journal of Laws of 2019, item 59)."
"Personal Data is processed solely for the purpose of supporting the public in preventing the spread of the pandemic"

": acting in the broadly understood public interest, the controller, by distributing and ensuring the operability of the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe application, supports the rapid exchange of information between natural persons within a specific community, acting for the prevention of public health and counteracting the spread of SARS CoV-2 virus and disease"

", through the exchange of anonymised information on infected persons and software enabling the analysis of meetings and contacts, as well as through algorithms enabling the assessment of the risk of infection."
"Personal Data regarding the User's health is also processed on the basis of"
"Article 9, paragraph 2, letter i of the GDPR"
"in connection with the public task of preventing, counteracting and combating"

"resulting from Article 1, 2, 3, 6 and 8a paragraph 1, 4 and 5 of the Act of 14 March 1985 on the State Sanitary Inspection (Journal of Laws of 2019, item 59), because processing is necessary for reasons related to the public interest in the field of public health, such as protection against serious cross-border health threats under the law of the Member State."

"STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe processes Personal Data that does not require identification as provided for in Article 11 of the GDPR. Neither GIS nor MC are able to identify the data subject (User). GIS adheres to the following Personal Data Processing principles:"

"it implements appropriate technical and organizational measures so that the processing of data about the Application Users takes place in an anonymous manner without their identification in accordance with the provisions on Personal Data protection and to be able to demonstrate it;"

"it supervises the security of Personal Data throughout the entire period of their possession in a manner ensuring, in particular, protection against unauthorised access, damage, destruction or loss;"
"it keeps confidential information about the User through the use of encryption;"
"it provides data subjects with the possibility to make use of their rights under the law."
"it maintains the confidentiality of Personal Data;"
"Providing Personal Data referred to in paragraph 5 point3 of this section is voluntary, but may condition the use of all the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe functionalities."
"The processed Personal Data are not made available to the Recipients of Personal Data in a form that would allow the identification of the data subject."
"The Processing of Personal Data in STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe shall be governed by Article 11 of the GDPR"
"the right to access Personal Data based on Article 15 of the GDPR;"
"the right to rectify Personal Data based on Article 16 of the GDPR;"
"the right to delete Personal Data based on Article 17 of the GDPR;"
"the right to request the Controller to limit the Processing of Personal Data based on Article 18 of the GDPR, subject to the cases referred to in Article 18 paragraph 2 of the GDPR;"
"the right to object to the Processing of Personal Data based on Article 21 of the GDPR."
"Exercising the rights referred to in paragraph 1 is possible by using the appropriate STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe functionalities."

"history of the Analytical Module analysis results from the last 14 days,"
"period of contact of Users' Devices, values in the range of 5-30 minutes,"
"date of contact of the Users' Devices."

"STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe will only be active during the pandemic period"
"and may be deactivated in accordance with the decision of the GIS. After stopping the use of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe, all Personal Data will be deleted along with the Application."

"The User's Personal Data in the form of an anonymous UID address may be transferred outside the European Economic Area as regards the use of the service provided by Cloudflare in order to prevent DDOS attacks and ensure the highest standards of Users' security. Cloudflare Inc remains a certified entity under the Privacy Shield certification programme, operating on the basis of the Commission Implementing Decision (EU) 2016/1250 of 12 July 2016 on the Privacy Shield. Such transfer will also take place only in an exceptional situation, in particular when the User uses the Application outside the European Economic Area."

"No decisions as part of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe are made in an automated manner within the meaning of Article 22 of the GDPR. This means that the fact of using the Application does not result in issuing any decisions in relation to the User that could have a legal effect or similarly significantly affect the User."
"STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe enables the User to exercise the right to delete Personal Data at any time:"

"In order to delete Personal Data from the Triage Module, the Health Diary Module and other data entered by the User, select on the main screen of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe the following: More, then My Data, then Manage Data, then Erase Data. After the User's confirmation, all data entered by the User will be irretrievably deleted."
"In order to delete Personal Data from the Analytical Module, the User has to:"
"for devices with iOS version 13.5 or 13.6, select the following: System Settings> Privacy> Health> COVID-19 Exposure Logging> Delete Exposure Log;"
"for Devices with iOS version 14, select the following: System Settings> Exposure Notifications -> Delete Exposure Log;"

"The User has the right to withdraw consent to the operation of the Analytical Module at any time, but the withdrawal of consent will not affect the lawfulness of the actions performed prior to its withdrawal. To withdraw consent related to the Analytical Module:"
"for Devices with iOS version 13.5 or 13.6, select the following: System Settings> Privacy> Health> COVID-19 Exposure Logging -> Disable Exposure Logging;"
"for Devices with iOS version 14, select System Settings > Exposure Notifications > Disable Exposure Logging;"
"for Devices with Android system, select the following: Settings -> Google -> Notifications about the risk of exposure to COVID-19 -> Disable Notifications about the risk of exposure;"
"after the User's confirmation, the Analytical Module will cease to operate."

"The User has the right to withdraw the consent expressed pursuant to Article 173 paragraph 1 of the Telecommunications Law at any time, but the withdrawal of consent will not affect the lawfulness of actions performed before its withdrawal. To withdraw consent, the User has to remove STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe from the Device."
"When the SARS-CoV-2 virus pandemic or the pandemic threat ends, the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Application will be deactivated."
"for devices with Android system, select the following: Settings> Google> Notifications about the risk of exposure to COVID-19> Delete random identifiers;"
"after the User's confirmation, all data related to the Analytical Module will be irretrievably deleted."
"For any questions and requests related to Users' rights, please contact us at:"

"The User has the right to lodge a complaint with the President of the Personal Data Protection Office if they consider that the Processing of their Personal Data violates the provisions of the GDPR or generally applicable provisions. The complaint can be sent in writing to the following address: Prezes Urzędu Ochrony Danych Osobowych, ul. Stawki 2,00-193 Warszawa or electronically via the ePUAP portal."

"STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe may contain links to other websites. Such websites operate independently of GIS and are not supervised by it in any way. These websites sites may have their own privacy policies, which we recommend that the User should familiarise with."
"GIS reserves the right to amend the Privacy Policy by publishing a new Privacy Policy on the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe website."

"Using the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Application is free of charge and includes the Analytical Module, the Triage Module and the Health Diary Module, as well as support in the prophylaxis and prevention of infection, together with relevant information related to the pandemic"

"and a reminder of safe behaviour and daily hygiene habits. STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe enables to determine risk factors for infection, create and keep a medical history, including existing diseases and current pharmacotherapy, as well as keep a prevention diary. STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe provides Users with information and the guidelines issued by WHO and GIS, but the information provided is not a medical consultation or health service (in particular medical or pharmaceutical one)."

"Using the Analytical Module is voluntary. The Analytical Module is provided with the use of Bluetooth technology and requires the activation of the Bluetooth module in the Device, as well as, for Devices with the Android operating system, enabling the system option of recording exposure"

"and granting consent for location (STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe does not use GPS data in the scope of the Bluetooth module), and for Devices with the iOS operating system: selecting the option Recording exposure to"

". In order to effectively use the full functionality of the Analytical Module, the Application should be left running in the background. The application running in the background will scan the environment in search of Devices of other Application Users, and it will also be scanned by other Devices. The Application User's Device saves the history of encountering other Devices on which the Application is installed. This information (history of devices encountered) remains on Users' Devices for 14 days."
"The Contact Centre consultant, providing information about the infection by phone"

"After the Application User's Device receives the Diagnostic Key, the Analytical Module performs an analysis by comparing the Diagnostic Key with historical data on encountering other Devices with the installed Application stored locally on the User's Device in order to assess the risk of exposure to infection"
". If the analysis of the likelihood of infection"
"shows a high or medium risk of exposure to infection"
"the User's status in the Application will change accordingly. "
"Entering the PIN Code to STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe by the User is voluntary."
"The condition for using STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe is that the User has an appropriate Device with up-to-date software and connected to the Internet."
"Using STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe is possible without territorial restrictions."

"Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 are not responsible for any difficulties in using the Application resulting from failure to meet the technical requirements indicated in paragraph 1, including incorrect configuration of the Device, or resulting from problems with the Device or the User's Internet connection."

"The liability of Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2"

"Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 undertake to make every effort to ensure the operation of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe without any disruptions, as well as to provide the most current WHO or GIS guidelines."

"The character of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe is informative. Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 do not provide health services (in particular medical or pharmaceutical), are not intermediaries of the above-mentioned services, and do not carry out medical activities through STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe. In connection with the above, Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 shall not be liable for any consequences resulting from the User's use of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe in the area of health and life."

"The use of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe cannot replace health services, including the need to consult a doctor or the competent sanitary and epidemiological station. If the User notices any deterioration of their health or has doubts about their health, they should immediately contact the emergency number"
"in order to call an ambulance or inform the competent sanitary and epidemiological station or go to the nearest health care facility."

"If the use of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe is not possible, it is difficult or takes too long, and the health or well-being of the User deteriorates, the User should immediately call the emergency number"
"in order to call an ambulance or inform the competent sanitary and epidemiological station or go to the nearest health care facility."

"In special cases, affecting the security or stability of the ICT system, Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 have the right to temporarily cease or limit the operation of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe or the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe functionalities, without prior notification to Users. In particular, Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 are entitled to carry out maintenance work to restore the security and stability of the ICT system. The STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe User shall not be entitled to any claims in connection with the interruption or cessation of the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe operation by the Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2."

"Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 also have the right to cease the operation of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe at any time, if such a justified request is submitted by an Internet provider or other authorised entity. Subject to the relevant provisions of law and these Terms & Conditions, Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 are not responsible for damages caused by malfunction of the transmission system, including hardware failures, delays and disruptions in the transmission of information."
"Conditions of cessation of use of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe"
"The User may cease using STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe with immediate effect and without indicating the reasons by removing STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe from their Device."

"GIS may cease providing, supporting and updating STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe with immediate effect by sending the User an appropriate statement via the Application or other available means of communication."

"Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 will not be liable for failure to fulfil their obligations under these Terms & Conditions in time, whenever their fulfilment is delayed or impossible due to circumstances or events beyond the control of the Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2, which prevent or significantly hinder the Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 to act in accordance with the Terms & Conditions, such as, but not limited to: fire, flood, imposition of an embargo, strike, riots, inability to secure materials and infrastructure, failure or interruption of machinery, in each case for reasons beyond the control of the Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2.If such a delay lasts longer than 30 (thirty) days, the Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 will have the right to cease providing, supporting and updating STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe with immediate effect."
"Detailed rules regarding the privacy of STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe Users and other people using STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe or any form of contact are described in the Privacy Policy."
"Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 reserve the right to make changes to the Terms & Conditions. The current version of the Terms & Conditions will be available in STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe."

"Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 inform that the installation of the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe update may be necessary for the proper functioning of the Application and proper protection of the data contained in the Application."
"Entities referred to in § 2 point1 and 2 may terminate the STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe operation at any time."
"Any possible disputes, which may arise between the Entities referred to in § 2 paragraph 1 and 2, and the User shall be governed by Polish law."

"STOP COVID - ProteGO Safe is a free application that allows you to assess the risk of coronavirus infection based on the guidelines of the World Health Organization (WHO), keep a health diary and learn more about prevention. By observing the results and applying remedial measures, you minimise the risk of getting sick with"

"If you erase your data, the app will become unusable. The archive of your Health Diary will be lost, and all data will have to be re-entered."
"Are you sure you want to erase the data?"

"This operation cannot be undone. You will lose all history and all data provided. To continue using the application, you will have to provide your data again. In order to fully erase the data, we can move you to the system settings, where you can also erase the meeting data."
